baseline_groups.claim_summary: First-term mayors (who can seek reelection) have lower corruption (pcorrupt) than term-limited second-term mayors, consistent with electoral accountability disciplining incumbents.
baseline_groups.notes: Table 4 Column 6. Cross-sectional OLS with 41 controls and state FE, HC1 robust SE. Sample: all 476 municipalities with esample2==1.

global_notes: Surface defined one baseline group (G1: pcorrupt ~ first). No changes from the pre-run surface. All 53 specifications executed successfully. All coefficients are negative, consistent with the paper's claim. The effect is robustly significant across all control progressions, LOO variants, random subsets, FE variants, sample trimming, and functional form transformations.
